meanings.definition: The state or quality of being limited.
meanings.sent1: The limitedness of the space in the room made it feel cozy.
meanings.sent2: The limitedness of his vocabulary hindered his ability to express himself fully.
meanings.sent3: The limitedness of the cookie jar caused a comical struggle for the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity knew no bounds, breaking free from the limitedness of traditional art.
meanings.sent5: The limitedness of time before the deadline spurred them to work efficiently.

meanings.definition: The condition of having restrictions or constraints.
meanings.sent1: The limitedness of the rules made the game challenging.
meanings.sent2: She felt frustrated by the limitedness of her options.
meanings.sent3: The limitedness of the diet plan led to some amusing culinary experiments.
meanings.sent4: His dreams soared above the limitedness of reality.
meanings.sent5: The limitedness of resources forced them to be creative in problem-solving.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is restricted or confined.
meanings.sent1: The limitedness of the box made it perfect for storing small items.
meanings.sent2: The limitedness of the road caused traffic congestion.
meanings.sent3: The limitedness of the elevator capacity led to a humorous situation.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts expanded beyond the limitedness of the classroom walls.
meanings.sent5: The limitedness of the budget required careful planning for the project.
